text_original: twenty eight years ago Mrs Costa's daughter marie died.  she blamed the hospital because they got her out of bed while she was still in etha. there was a chair and when mrs costa asked why there was a chair they said she had collapsed after they got her out of bed.  i asked why they got her out of bed as she was still sick. she got her dress and coat to take to the hospital after they called her to be collected.  she put a big pot of coffee on ready for marie to come home as she mentioned she wanted coffee.  she told her son to keep the dinner ready for her husband who will be home soon.  when he got home he went upstairs to change and shave and waited on the step.  when she got to the hospital, marie was waving at the window and then went to say her goodbyes to everyone.  Mrs Costa had had 3 operations in a year at the hospital.  she was praying for a neighbour who was just about to have an operation.  she had a large family.  when she got in the hospital the nurses were there to explain her daughter was dying.. mrs costa lost control and shouted at the nurses and doctors that they had killed her.  they wanted to know how marie had died but mrs costa told them if they touched her daughter she would kill them and burn down the hospital not caring who was inside.   when she saw her daughter who had died she had large beads of sweat on her.  her leg was solid.  they think she had a blood clot.  mrs costa was histerical and her hair was pulled out and her face was a mess.  when she went home her husband asked her what was wrong and when she told him their daughter was dead he had a heart attack.  her son went to mrs costas 2 sisters to tell the news, he was upset and teary eyed.  her 2 sisters came over, one had the largest orange she had ever seen.

text_original: I went to the hospital to see my daughter Marie, it was the 28th of the month, she had been very sick and the doctors didn't know what was wrong with her, they said to me Mrs Costa we are not sure what is wrong with your daughter. She then started to get better and they said she could come home, I took her nice dress and clothes for her to come home in, there was a chair in front of her bed and I asked why it was there and they said she needed to sit in it. They  tried to put her in the seat but she collapsed, I left the room and when I went back in she was on the bed, they said she had a cold chill and I noticed sweat on her giant sweat balls, I said you have killed her, she was so cold. They tried to get her up but she collapsed on the floor, it was a marble floor and she just lay there and they said she was dead. I asked how it could have happened and they said it was a blood clot in her leg, she was only 18 years old. You killed her I screamed, I screamed it at the nurses and doctors, You Killed her, over and over again. Her brother Michael turned up and I said Michael they killed her, He said No, We have prepared her room at home. Her father had been working down the garden but had also come to the hospital. He said he needed to tell Auntie Jenny and Auntie Millie. The whole town had heard that Marie had died, she was only 18 and had died on the 30 no 28 years ago. Michael had also died as had his Dad.

text_original: Mrs Costa had a daughter called Marie, Marie had been in hospital and was due to be discharged. On the day she was being dishcarged Mrs Costa went to the hospital, she had packed her bag and when she got to the hospital Marie was on the bed. There was a nurse aid and a doctor, she was a female doctor. They asked if Mrs Costa had ever had fainting spells. Then the doctors were running. It was Marie. When Mrs Costa went into the room Marie was on the bed and had large beads of sweat dripping down her face. Mrs Costa got very angry and could see that Marie was very unwell. She accused the hospital of killing her daughter. The female doctor tried to calm her down and give her a shot but she refused, she just kept yelling that she had killer her daughter. When Mrs Costa left the hospital hadnt told the admin team about what happened so they kept calling her at the shop asking if she had been to pick Marie up yet. She went back to the hospital and was shouting at them, she was pulling her hair up. When she went back home she sat on the step and told her husband what happened and he had a heart attack. There son Michael then came home and they told him about Marie and he also had a heart attack. Mrs Costa had two sisters and there other son went to there house to tell them what happened. They had assumed that they were there to tell them Marie was home as they had all been waiting for her to be discharged but he told them she had died.

text_original: Mrs Costa's daughter Marie died 28 years ago after an operation for appendicitis . I was a shock as she seemed to be recovered and Mrs Costa was going to collet her with some clothes. She left Rita, her other daughter cooking and making coffee ready for their return. Her husband Mike was coming home, after shaving he sat on the step to wait. At the hospital Mrs Costa was waiting when all the alarms sounded and to her dismay it was for her daughter. Marie died and Mrs Costa was naturally hysterical. She went home and when she told her husband Mike and son Michael they both had heart attacks. Rita still gets a pain in her leg in sympathy with Marie who died from a similar blood clot. She sent her other son Jamie to inform her sisters of the tragic news. I think she still lives in the same area as the shopkeeper was talking to her about Marie.

text_original: Mrs. Costa lost her daughter Marie 30 years ago this April. She got a blood clot after an appendisitis operation. Mrs. Costa went to the hospital to pick up her daughter, she had marie's dress and coat hanging on her arm. She was sitting in the hospital waiting and she was praying for a mother of 10 to survive. Mrs. Costa had had 3 surgeries in one year so she Knew everyone at this hospital.  Then the nurse came in for a blanket and she asked "Are you rushing for my daughter?" and the nurse said you can talk to her. Marie had huge beads of sweat and was unconscious. They made marie walk after her surgery while she was still under the Ether. "Why is this chair here?" Mrs. Costa asked, and was told the Doctor ordered it becasue they wanted Marie to walk but that caused the blood clot.  Mrs. Costa's other daughter Rita told everyone what happened. Before she left, she told her to put a pot of coffee, every morning she had and brought that first cup to her daughter. Her husband  Mike was waiting on the steps for Mrs. Costa to get back and when she got back he said, "What happened to you." Her hair was all pulled and her face was a mess because she was distraught at the hospital, screaming, "You killed my daughter". Mrs. Costa had her sons, Michael and James tell the relatives about the death of Marie. One had red eyes and Aunt Milly and Aunt Jenny asked him why he was crying and he said, "Marie is dead."

text_original: Mrs Costa lost her daughter Marie twenty eight years ago on 30th of April, ten days after an operation which took place in the night at Methodist Hospital. She was sedated with ether, which was used in operation at that time. While she was recovering gradually, her sister Veronica came over to visit her, but she was still sedated and was lying in bed. However, one the nurses insisted that she should be out of bed and made her. This caused Marie to collapse and had to put her back in bed. Mrs Costa was able to go home for a while. She did not have a phone in those days, so uses the Annie the shopkeeper's phone for the hospital to get in touch. One day, the hospital called to tell her Marie has been discharged, so she should go pick her up. Then she began to take Marie's dress and coat to take to the hospital. On arrival, she was informed that Marie had died, having collapsed due to blood clot.She was only thirteen years old. Mrs Costa lost it completely and accused all the medical staff of killing her daughter. One of her daughters, Rita, whom she left at home waited impatiently for their arrival and when it was not forthcoming, she headed to the hospital only to be told that her sister has died and she too lost it. Then they had to drive home to inform Marie's dad, Mike who was sitting on a step and her other siblings that she has died. On arrival back home, Mrs Costa was screaming to loud that the neighbours came out to find out what happened and were sad that Marie had died. When Mike was was informed of his daughter's death, he had a heart attack, which happened to his son Michael as well. The younger son Jamie was sent go inform their two Aunts - Jenny and Millie that their niece had died. The Aunts have preparing and looking forward to Marie's arrival back home, so they were shocked to discover she had passed. Mrs Costa also informed her brother-in-law, who has since passed and was an undertaker.
text_again: I think I remember her daughter was hospitalised and the plan was for her to be discharged. Then it was discovered that she collapsed while she was about to get up from the bed. Meanwhile her mother was already planning her homecoming and was making her way to the hospital to collect her daughter. Unfortunately, her daughter died shortly after she got to the hospital and being overcome with grief, she blamed all the hospital staff for her loss.

text_original:
Mrs. Costa's daughter, Marie, died 28 years ago. She had gone to the hospital for an appendectomy. Mrs. Costa had waited for the call to pick her up after 10 days. When she got to the hospital she waited and then the nurses took her into the room and Marie was in a cold sweat. Mrs. Costa was hysterical, screaming and such. They took her to the office and attempted to administer some medication to calm her down but she refused and threatened the hospital workers, she threatened to burn down the hospital. 

Eventually they took her home, she was screaming on the car ride home and in the driveway. The neighbors were coming out because they heard all of the screaming. Marie's father had been waiting on the step for her to arrive home with Mrs. Costa, but when he heard that Marie had died he had a heart attack. Marie's brother also had a heart attack. 

The youngest boy was sent to inform Mrs. Costa's sisters. Later it was confirmed that Marie had complained of a pain in her leg and loss of vision while she was saying goodbye to other patients, it turns out she had a blood clot.
text_again: I remember that a woman had lost her daughter. They had taken her to a psychiatric hospital and when she was due to be released the mother used a neighbor's phone to call and they indicated that the daughter was ready to be picked up. When the mother arrived, they asked her to sit down and explained that the daughter had died, apparently from a fall. The mother went home and found the brother sitting on the front porch, he was given the news and was told to go tell another family member while the mother waited for the father to arrive home from work. Neighbors noticed and came out to give condolences.

text_original: My daughter died 28 years ago. On the 30th of April. My daughter Rita went to the hospital to see Marie and there was a chair at the foot of the bed. She asked the nurses why there was a chair there. They said that Marie would have to sit on it. Marie had blood clots in her leg. She was eighteen. Someone who called me 'Mrs Costa' called me and told me to go to the hospital. I had the coat and Marie's dress on my arm. The nurses told me Marie had collapsed. I told them that they killed her and that I'd burn the hospital down. Rita came in and collapsed, fell down like lightning. The back of her leg was hard as a pole. She had phlebitis. My husband was sat on the step outside our home. My face was a mess and I was screaming. Everyone came out their doors because of the noise. 'What happened?', he asked. 'Marie, she's gone. She's dead.' He had a heart attack. I told my son Michael and he had a heart attack too. I told my other son Jamie to go and tell his two aunts. There was a girl called Millie who was a very nice girl.
text_again: My daughter died at 28 years old in April. Her sister was in the hospital with her and asked the nurses why the chair was placed there. They said they needed her to sit on the chair to avoid blood clotting. I got a call that my daughter had died and I went to the hospital. I got very angry with the staff and was shouting at them. My other daughter came running in and collapsed on the floor. When we went home, my husband was sat on the steps outside. I told him that our daughter had died. We went inside and told our son to go to his aunts and tell them what happened. There was a coat hanging on the back of a chair and I told my husband to take it.

text_original: The woman's (Mary?) daughter, Marie, was in the hospital for an operation. Everything seemed to be going okay and the woman received a phone call to come and pick up her daughter as she was to be discharged. Her husband waited on the step and she went. She got to the hospital and sat down and someone asked her if her daughter ever fainted. She asked if that was who the nurse was running for, and then she went to her daughter's room. Her daughter was dressed on the bed with giant beads of sweat running down her head and the mother started yelling why did you kill my daughter. It's because you made her get up to because the doctor said she was to be moved but the 18-year old was still under ether. They got her up and she said she had a pain in her leg and collapsed. The mother continued screaming and pulling her own hair and as she was turned around, her daughter passed. Rita came and she asked what was the matter and the mother said that Marie had died. They went home and the husband was on the step and he asked what's the matter and he had a heart attack when he heard. Her son Michael also had a heart attack. A person said later how she could picture Marie standing near the store, who was a shy and pleasant girl.
text_again: There was a lady and her daughter was in hospital (for an operation?). She went to the hospital and the nurses and doctors made her daughter get up to move her to another bed? She didn't think this was a good idea but they did it anyway. Her daughter went funny and suddenly died and the woman was very upset about it and shouted (I think) at them. Then she went home after talking to someone in a waiting room, or something. The girl's brother or dad was waiting for the girl to come home but the woman had to tell them she had died and then the father killed himself and someone remembered her in the shop a while back.

text_original: It was 28 years ago that my daughter died. My daughter Victoria is here. My daughter died on the 30th of April. Or 20th. It was ten days before. We were eager to see Marie as she collapsed on the ground one day and she was taken to a hospital. When doctor called to say to come in I was ready to do it and I told one of my daughters to stop cooking and I took a dress, Millies dress so that I could bring it to the hospital. Dad was also happy to go to hospital but he was busy. I have a few daughters. And Aunt Milly is also my relative. I also have a son in law. So I was eager to see Marie and I went to the hospital. I knew there was a lady in there who had gallblader problems and she was dying too. I saw my daughter with pearls of sweat on her head and her leg was like a pole, she was dead and I screamed no you killed her to the doctors but people kept trying to calm me. I was in shock and I screamed in my car and I kept saying no it cant happen, she is dead and they killed her. I called dad and explained it, he was so ready to see her and Rita as well and son in law. But she was dead and it turns out she had a blood clot in her leg which is why her leg was like a pole. My daughter Marie was dead and she was only 18 years old. I was devastated and I didnt let them touch my Marie as I did not want anyone to do anything to her more. I brought her dress but she was dead. Then after hearing it from me dad had a heart attack and my husband died from a heart attack. I could not believe it. Thats the story.
text_again: It is me Laura, my other daughter and myself, mom, here pondering. The memories come back. Fifteen years ago my daughter collapsed one day. She collapsed on the floor and we took her to a hospital. At the hospital she was very frail, sickly. I cried and went back home to find my husband asking what happened and I explained the story. Cousins also got very confused and wanted to see her at the hospital. I decided to visit her at the hospital. I called Laura and she said to take a scarf to my sick daughter so I looked for it in the closet. I found a red scarf that she likes and so I went to the hospital with family to visit her. Husband was on the phone, he did not hear what I said about going there. When I went to the hospital I went into her room and there was another sick lady laying on the bed. She had dementia. There was my daughter laying in bed. The doctor came in and told us she has cancer and I collapsed to the floor screaming from terror. Doctor said there was nothing they could do. I cried and I held my daughter, I was very upset and it was the worst thing that could happen to a mother. My daughter was dying. I remember this day vividly. My daughter was so beautiful and had long hair. After she died me and Laura remembered her together, its like it happened yesterday and I remember every detail.

text_original: the story is a sad and heartbreaking one. was about a young lady Marie, a 28 year old, she died very close to her birthday. after staying a while in the hospital, everyone was expecting her return, a small party was likely gonna happened, but unfortunately, she died instead of getting discharged. The news shocked everyone. Her father and brother had instant heart attack when the news broke. Call wasn't made to Marie's aunt, young Jammie was sent, aunt was excited to see him, until she had a close look at him to realize his eyes were red from crying. Mrs Costa, Marie's mom was quiet popular in the neighbourhood, so is Marie, even though she a calm, quiet and easy going young lady. Mrs Costa doesn't have a phone, she got the call from a lady at the store at about a quarter to five in the night that Marie is getting discharged and she should pick her up.Rita was cooking and was told to finish ASAP. Mrs Costa ordered that coffee be made for Marie because she had long wished for it, cake was also ordered for from the bakery. Mrs Costa got really emotional at the hospital, accusing the doctors, nurses and aides of killing her daughter. she was a regular service user in the hospital, typically knows most of the staff there. she believed the blood clot her daughter had was the hospital's mistake.she was mad when  her daughter was about to be moved out of bed, she told them she is too sick and still under ether, but the nurse responded that it was the doctors' instruction she had to follow, even though they had to put her back on bed after she passed away
text_again: a woman lost her daughter on a day close to her birthday. it was such a sad moment. she was very ill and was expected to be discharged shortly. her family was already expecting her, there was preparation for her homecoming, she loved coffee so much and had missed it, so it was part of the preparations underway a home. unfortunately she could not make it home, her mom was called on a phone in a nearby grocery store. it was so shocking. she stormed the hospital and cursed almost everyone. she blamed them all for negligence. Back at home, the deceased younger brother was sent to her aunt, aunt was expecting to be told that her sick siste was back home and better, but lo and behold, it was the other way round.

text_original:
Mrs Costa had a daughter who was in the hospital who had gone in for an operation for appendicitis. The day after the operation her other daughter went to see how Marie was but she was still under the effects of anaesthetic. But the nurses were trying to get her out of bed because the doctors had told them to do so. Then she seemed to get a blood clot but they wanted to discharge her. Back at home Mrs Costa was cooking and making coffee and getting clothes ready to take to the hospital for her discharge. She went to the hospital but when she got there her daughter had died. She was angry and upset and praying and being annoyed with the nurses for killing her daughter. She was hysterical at the hospital shouting at the doctors and nurses that they had killed her daughter.. 

Back at home she was still hysterical but told her son to tell the aunties that Marie had died but he was very upset and crying and didn't want to go and see them but he did and they were all in shock at the news, even people in the neighborhood or the store. They reminisced about Marie when she was young and playing at the store.

She went to see her the day after the operation but her daughter was still dozy from the anaesthetic and wanted to stay in bed. But the doctor said she needed to get up and walk about. Mrs Costa was very angry and shouting and accused the hospital of killing her daughter. She went home and had to tell the family that her daughter had died unexpectedly but so was so upset that she couldn't go and tell them so she got her son to do it instead. He told everyone he could think of and many people started remembering her when she was young and used to play in the street

text_original: Marie was a quiet and shy girl. One day she had to go under for an operation at the hospital, this happened 28 years ago. Her sister Rita visited the hospital, and she found the nurses carrying her from the bed she told them to stop because Marie was still under anesthesia she was going to end up having a blood clot. At home, her mother, Mrs Cost,a was waiting for her daughter to be discharged from the hospital. The hospital tried reaching out to Mrs Costa but to know avail because she didn't have a phone. So they called at the shop.The shop owner told Mrs Costa that the hospital needs her to come and fetch her daughter. She hurriedly left the house, asked her youngest daughter to finish cooking, and made some coffee for herself. When she arrived, her daughter was still alive, but she eventually died. Mrs Costa got very mad she was shouting at the hospital staff, saying that they killed her daughter. Her daughter Rita came to the hospital, she was told the bad news, she fell and hurt her leg, which is still giving her problems until now. They left the hospital and went home, her husband was waiting to welcome her daughter. Mrs Costa then sent her lastborn son to tell her sisters and her mother what had happened

text_original:
Mrs Costa's daughter, Marie, died about 38 years ago. She had had an operation in April for appendicitis and made a good recovery but died 10 days later. It was the day she was being discharged and she had her housecoat on. The Methodist hospital had rung the local shop to let them know Marie was ready to be discharged as the Costa's didn't have a home phone. Mrs Costa had to pay an extra $10 for her board. Mrs Costa told her other daughter to have coffee ready for them when they got back from the hospital. Mrs Costa;s sister had bought Marie an orange for when she got home. 
When Mrs Costa got to the hospital there was a delay and she wondered what was going on. The hospital kept ringing the shop to tell them to tell mrs costa to pick up Marie but the shop lady said she had already left. Eventually a nurse told Mrs Costa that there was a problem. She ran down the corridor and and saw Marie on the bed. She was covered in sweat. She had been walking down the corridor with a friend and told her she had a pain in her leg and couldn't see, then she collapsed. Mrs Costa was distraught and tore her hair out of its style. WHen she got home she told her husband and son Michael They both had heart attacks
The shop lady still talks about Marie and how lovely she was
text_again:
The woman was telling the story of how her daughter had died. This was a long time ago, over 20 years I think. Her daughter had been in hospital for an operation. The family didn't have a phone so they rang the local shop instead, to pass on the message that she was ready to be discharged. Her mother went in to collect her. She was in the waiting room when she saw a commotion and lots of nurses running around. No one was paying her any attention. In the end she ran down the corridor into her daughters room and saw her daughter lying dead on the bed. The doctors told her her daughter had just been walking down the corridor with a friend when she suddenly collapsed. There were no warning signs. 

I think the girl had a blood clot that killed her instantly. She had been in hospital for a couple of weeks

The womans husband died young because of it, I think it was heart related. 

The woman had to get her young son or nephew to tell the other relatives. 

There was something about asking someone else in the house to make a fresh pot of coffee, as her daughter had been looking forward to that.

text_original: Mary's daughter had to go to hospital to have an operation. She ended up being in hospital for 10 days. She was only 18 at the time. She then got the call to come and pick her up but they didn't have a phone so the hospital call the local store to pass the message on. When she went to pick up Maria (her daughter) from the hospital it turned out Maria had died while she was waiting. It was later found out it was a bloody clot that caused the death. Mrs Costa broken down and was going crazy, her husband was waiting at home for the mother and daughter to come home but they didn't. There other daughter went to the hospital to see where they were and found out that Maria had died and she collapsed as well. When they both eventually came back to the house and informed the family what had happen her husband had a heart attack and so did her son. Her two sisters were also there and were a mess when they were told the news
text_again:
So girl had gone to hospital to have a routine operation her mum had dropped at the hospital and she was told the hospital would be in contact to pick up up later. The mum didn't receive a call all day and the hospital could not get hold of her so they rang the local bar in the town and the woman behind the bar pass the message on to the mother that she need to go to the hospital. When she got to the hospital she was told that her daughter had died, she was distraught and collapsed on the floor say she wanted to see her and this couldn't be true. At the same time her other daughter had turned up at the hospital and saw her mum as she explained that her sister was dead. Her other daughter then fainted and the hospital wanted to help but the mum said you are not touching her as I don't want you to kill my other daughter as well. 

They had the phoned home to explain what had happened, the father was at the bar so he had to rush home and inform the family of what had happened. When the mother and daughter got home all the family were their, aunties, uncles etc and all very upset and trying to take stock of what had happened

text_original: Mother took her daughter to hospital for operation, marie. she was waiting that the daughter will go back home healed, the operation was done and everything was going down well. they would go to vist her every now and then with her other elder daughter. the sister would vist her they would talk and then go back home. on the day she was suuporsed to be discharged mother went to take her, when she was waiting she would pray for another woman who was also operated to get well soon so that she go back to her kids little did she new her daugher condition was even worse. the nurse asked her if her daughter to faint, as she was rushing towards her room, the mother followed her only to find the marlie dying. She started to shout you have killed my daugter all over, she would not even listen to nurses that were trying to consult her. At home they were all waiting for her to come back with Marlie, the sister come to the hospital and when their mother told her marlie has died she collapsed. the mother was screaming all the way to their home, the father asked what was the matter and he was told marlie has died, the brother also was told. Her aunts were waiting to hear their niece was back so they can vist her. the brother was sent to the aunts place to tell them what happened. They were cleaning the compound whe he arrived and they were expecting good news only to realise the boys eyes were full red, he told them marlie died
text_again: we took our daughter to hospital for treatment. she was admited and we used to go and visit during visit hours every day, me and my other daughter. she was doing well we had all hope of going with her back home sooner. one day i left as usual to go to the hospital, there father was around and he was hoping i will come back with her. i reached the hospital but i was denied to go in her ward as nurses claimed there was an emergency, they were running up and down. i was shocked but i heard to wait. i went in later and found her fainted, only to be told she was dead. i screamed everywhere feeling like this has happened due hospital recklessness, my second came and when she heard the news was so shocked, we all cried. we later went home only to find there father waiting for us unaware of what had happened. we told him, their younger brother was also told what had happened. the whole family started moarning. we sent the brother to their aunts place, he found them out doing there daily chore, they were happy to see him as they were expecting good news, probably she has been discharged only for them to see the sadness on his face and they knew all was not well, they were told the news and all became sad

text_original:
The woman (Mrs Costa) was recounting how her daughter (Marie) died after with a blood clot after an operation for appendicitis 28 years ago. She blamed the hospital and doctors for moving her daughter which lead to the blood clot, something about moving her to a chair to start with and then something later on about Marie walking with someone and saying she couldn't see properly and her leg hurt. 
She got the call at home to come and pick her up so told her daughter Rita that she was going to pick her up. When she got there she was told to sit and wait and overheard something about another woman who had young daughters who was sick and she was praying for her. A nurse got a call and came and asked if her daughter had a history of fainting, they went to the room and her daughter was covered in sweat and she started yelling at the staff, her daughter passed away just before or after a doctor came in which she accused them of killing her daughter.
The mother was overwhelmed and freaked out to the point of banging her head against the wall and they wanted to give her a shot to calm her down and she accused them of wanting to kill her, and mentioned something about having a few operations (3?) that year so the staff knew her.
Rita came and was told and she dropped to the ground, which was explicitly mentioned as marble. Then they made her way home with her husband and mentioned that her husband died of a heart attack and also I think her brother but timeline is unclear on that. Her brother in law was an undertaker and she tried to call but couldn't get a hold of him so she sent her young son, and Mrs Costa's sister and I think sister in law thought the son was coming to say that Marie was home, but then they noticed the son's eyes were red.
Then it became a lot more rambling and I think it was a shopkeeper she had a conversation with about her daughter and that she was quiet and used to sit on the steps or something. That's about all I remember
text_again:
The woman was recounting in a very rambling and unnecessarily detailed way how her daughter had died from a blood clot after an operation for appendicitis and how it was the hospitals fault making her stand up and walk around. She started out being specific with dates, I think 28 years ago when her daughter died. 

She was at home and got a call while she was with her other daughter who was baking something, and was told she could come and pick her daughter up from the hospital. 
She got to the hospital and was told to take a seat, she recounted something about a friend or friends child who was in the hospital, she heard an emergency being called which I think prompted that, then a nurse asked her if her child had previously had any fainting spells or other medical problems. They made it to the woman's daughters room and during that time her daughter passed away. The woman became inconsolable and blaming the hospital for the death of her child to the point where they wanted to sedate her, she mentioned that they were trying to kill her like they did her daughter and other irrational things. The woman mentioned that she'd been in the hospital a number of times herself to the extent where she knew the staff and they her.

She recalled she got home and then launched into a thing saying things about how her husband and brother both died of heart attacks but didn't clarify until later in the rambling that it was much later on when in the initial context sounded like it was around the same time. 
Her young son met her when she got home where she told him the news and to go to her sister, the child's uncle or aunt, who's partner was either an undertaker or mortician, and recounted how the male wasn't there and how the woman and another woman there thought he was coming to tell them his sister was home from the hospital. 

Then she started talking about her daughter and her attributes, and how she went to the shops and spoke to the person behind the counter, and how her daughter who'd passed would sit at the steps. 

This is about the extent I remember!

text_original:
My daughter died. It'll be 28 years this month. She died at Methodist hospital of appendicitis. Sunday morning, my oldest daughter went to see her, and she was still under ether. They used a lot of ether. 

There was a chair there. I asked the nurse, "What's this chair doing here. What's this chair doing here? We've got to get her out of bed."

"What are you talking about?" the nurse replied. "She's still under ether. That's doctor's orders."

They had to put her back in bed. I blame them for the blood clot she got.

After 10 days, I waited for a call from the hospital. "Go pick Marie up," the lady in the store said. "She's discharged."

She was operated on in April. The twentieth of April. It was kind of chilly that day.

And I went to the hospital, but when I got there, the nurse told me to sit down for a while. I prayed for another lady there who had an operation on her gall bladder. She'd been in bad shape, and I didn't want God to take that mother away from her children. I started getting chills thinking about it. 

When I got to visit my daughter, she went into a cold sweat. I was asked by the nurse if my daughter had ever gotten into a fainting spell. My daughter ended up bedridden, beads of sweat pouring from her face. I yelled at the nurses that they only kept killing her. 

They'd call for the doctor, who came in moments later. "You're killing my daughter!" I'd say again. "You're killing her!"

"Please try and talk to her," the doctor would say.

"Talk to her? My daughter's dying. What am I supposed to tell her?"

She was only 18 years old. And as I turned my back, she would pass away. I was getting ready to go home as my husband waited for me. He wondered when I would come back, because the people in the office didn't know what had happened yet. 

"Mother must have gotten really worked up about Marie," my eldest would say. "Must have gotten really upset that she made herself sick."

I was all pulled apart the next time I came to visit. One doctor wanted to give me a shot, while another nurse came over. That moment, I'd thought they were all trying to kill me too.

We lost Marie. Marie died. 

She suffered, seven to nine weeks at a time. But how did they figure out how Marie died, if at all?
text_again:
My daughter died. It'll be 28 years this month. She died at Methodist Hospital of appendicitis on Sunday Morning. 

My oldest daughter went to see her. She was under ether. They used a lot of ether. There was a chair there.

"What's this chair doing here?" I told the nurse. "We've got to get her out of bed."

"What are you talking about?" The nurse said. "She's still under ether. That's doctor's orders."

They had to put her back in bed. I blame them for the blood clot that she got. 

After 10 days, I waited for a call from the hospital. 

"Go pick Marie up. She's discharged."

Since she's been gone, I've never forgotten to put a cup of coffee for her each morning. She was operated on in March - I mean April. The twentieth of April. It was kind of chilly.

She saw me from windows on Wolf Street. They told me on the phone it would be $10 for her board. And I went, but when I got there, the nurse told me to sit down for a while. 

I prayed for another lady in the hospital who had an operation for her gall bladder. She was in bad shape, and I didn't want God to take that mother away from her children.

I started getting chills thinking about it. She went into a cold sweat, and I was asked if my daughter had ever got into a fainting spell. My daughter ended up bedridden, beads of sweat pouring from her. I yelled at the nurses that they kept killing her.

The doctor came in, and I told her that she killed her. She simply told me to talk to her.


"Talk to her?! My daughter's dying. What am I supposed to tell her?"

She was only 18 years old. As I turned my back, my daughter passed away. I was getting ready to go home. My husband waited for me, wondering when I would come back. The people in the office didn't know what had happened yet, asking when I would come to pick her up from the hospital.

"Mother must have gotten really worked up about Marie," my eldest would say. "Must have gotten really upset that she made herself sick." 

I was all pulled apart the next time I came to visit. One doctor wanted to give me a shot. Another nurse came over. That moment, I'd thought they were all trying to kill me too.

We lost Marie. Marie died.

She suffered, seven to nine weeks at a time. But how did they figure out how Marie died, if at all?

text_original: A mother, Mrs Costa, recalls the death of her daughter, Marie, which occured 28 years previously, and describes the impact it had on herself and her family. Marie had taken ill with appendicitis and been admitted to hospital, needing an operation. After the operation and some time in hospital Mrs Costa receives a call to collect her daughter and take her home. Mrs Costa makes her preparations and turns up at the hospital wherupon things take a sudden downward turn. A nurse asks Mrs Costa if her daughter is prone to fainting. It transpires Marie has taken very ill and is sweating profusely, then soon after dies in the hospital room with Mrs Costa present. Mrs Costa recalls the tragic moment, how she was hysterical and out of her mind with teh shock. She accused the hospital staff of killing her daughter. Then afterwards she recounts telling her husband, how the shock gave him a heart attack. Then her son also suffered a heart attack upon receiving the news. She had to tell many other family members the tragic news, her other offspring, her sisters, her brother in law who was an undertaker. All this time later, the shock and sadness of losing Marie still resonates as much as ever.
text_again: The story was about a mother who lost her daughter, who died in hospital at a young adult age. The mother described the whole expeience and how the tradegy affected her and the rest of the family. The mother was incredibly distraught during that time, suffering a breakdown at the hospital and blaming staff for the death of her daughter. There had been some kind of confusion about her treatment. The mother had been notified to go to the hospital to see her daughter, expecting her to alive when she got there, but she had become deceased around the time of her arrival. Emotional, chaotic scenes followed at the hospital and accusations were made by the mother about the situation. She described how the news quickly traveled to the rest of the family, to her husband and her other children and extended family. Someone in the family suffered a heart attack. The mother's sense of grief and loss was extremely palpable throughout her telling of the story.
